original: @233b # // rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @233b # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: badzra b'a r'a hy'a ba shya bi dhi:/
analyzed: badzra b'a r'a hy'a ba shya bi dhi:/
translated: vajravārāhīvaśya-vidhi

original: bod skad du //
analyzed: bod skad du //
translated: In Tibetan:🔽The ritual for subjugating Vajravārāhī

original: rdo rje phag mo'i dbang du bya ba'i cho ga / rdo rje phag mo la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo'i dbang du bya ba'i cho ga / rdo rje phag mo la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Vajravārāhī.

original: sems can rnams dbang du bya ba 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la gzhug nas dbang gi cho ga brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams dbang du bya ba 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la gzhug nas dbang gi cho ga brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having introduced sentient beings to be subjugated to the four noble truths, the ritual for subjugation should be explained.

original: de nas sngon du gsungs pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das ma mchog tu dmar ba rdzogs par bskyed nas sa bon dang mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa las sku mdog dmar mo rnam par bsgoms nas yang dag par mchod pa dang bstod pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sngon du gsungs pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das ma mchog tu dmar ba rdzogs par bskyed nas sa bon dang mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa las sku mdog dmar mo rnam par bsgoms nas yang dag par mchod pa dang bstod pa bya'o //
translated: Then, having generated the supreme red Bhagavatī in complete form according to the previously taught stages, having visualized the red-colored form arisen from the seed syllable and sign transformation, one should make perfect offerings and praises.

original: mi bskyod rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis de nyid gsum dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis de nyid gsum dbul bar bya'o //
translated: With the verses beginning with Akṣobhya Vajra, one should offer the three realities.

original: kha thur du bstan pa'i thod pa gsum gyi steng du aa yig dmar po las byung ba'i padma'i snod du dam tshig bcu dang dbyangs yig bcu drug la sogs pa gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhis byin gyis brlabs par bltas la /
analyzed: kha thur du bstan pa'i thod pa gsum gyi steng du aa yig dmar po las byung ba'i padma'i snod du dam tshig bcu dang dbyangs yig bcu drug la sogs pa gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhis byin gyis brlabs par bltas la /
translated: In the three skulls facing downward, one should visualize a lotus vessel arisen from the red letter A, consecrated by the ten commitments, the sixteen vowels, and the thirty-four consonants.🔽Below, the letters yam and ram transform into the mandalas of wind and fire, which cause the vessel to blaze and boil.

original: 'og tu yam dang ram yig yongs su gyur pa las rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor dag gis 'bar ba dang bsreg pa dag byas nas nye bar yang dag par bkod pa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bskul nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs rnams gdan drangs nas de🔽la nang du byas te /
analyzed: 'og tu yam dang ram yig yongs su gyur pa las rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor dag gis 'bar ba dang bsreg pa dag byas nas nye bar yang dag par bkod pa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bskul nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs rnams gdan drangs nas de la nang du byas te /
translated: Then, the seed syllables are energized by light rays, and the assembly of Tathagatas is invited and dissolves into the vessel.

original: dbyangs yig dang po las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng @234a * //
analyzed: dbyangs yig dang po las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng @234a * //
translated: Then, on a moon mandala arisen from the first vowel,

original: du h'um yig las skyes pa zla ba la gnas pa des byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje dkar po rtse lnga pa 'phro bzhin pa'i 'od zer gyi dra bas rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyang zla ba'i rdo rje la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: du h'um yig las skyes pa zla ba la gnas pa des byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje dkar po rtse lnga pa 'phro bzhin pa'i 'od zer gyi dra bas rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyang zla ba'i rdo rje la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The vajra-holder should also place the moon-vajra in the moon.

original: nye bar smin pa dang the tshom la sogs pa'i skyon du gyur na de'i steng du aom yig bsams nas de'i 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bdud rtsi'i gzugs su gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa na gnas pa'i bdud rtsi rnams kyang de
analyzed: nye bar smin pa dang the tshom la sogs pa'i skyon du gyur na de'i steng du aom yig bsams nas de'i 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bdud rtsi'i gzugs su gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa na gnas pa'i bdud rtsi rnams kyang de
translated: If there is a fault of ripening or doubt, and so on, then one should imagine the syllable oṃ, and the light rays from that cause the tathāgatas to become the form of elixir, and the elixirs that exist in the various world systems also enter into that.

original: la rab tu zhugs shing aom yig kyang zhugs te /
analyzed: la rab tu zhugs shing aom yig kyang zhugs te /
translated: The syllable oṃ also enters into that.

original: ji lta ba bzhin yongs su grub pa'i bdud rtsir bltas nas lan gsum de nyid gsum gyis brlabs nas cho ga bzhin du bdud rtsi myang ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin yongs su grub pa'i bdud rtsir bltas nas lan gsum de nyid gsum gyis brlabs nas cho ga bzhin du bdud rtsi myang ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Seeing the elixir that is completely accomplished just as it is, one should bless it three times with the three oṃs, and one should perform the tasting of the elixir, and so on, according to the rite.

original: ji srid 'dod kyi bar bsgoms nas rang gi ming gi yi ge yongs su gyur pa las bsgrub bya mdun du 'khor bar bltas shing de la sngags kyi phreng ba las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis de la bkug nas de la mang du bsgom par bya ste
analyzed: ji srid 'dod kyi bar bsgoms nas rang gi ming gi yi ge yongs su gyur pa las bsgrub bya mdun du 'khor bar bltas shing de la sngags kyi phreng ba las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis de la bkug nas de la mang du bsgom par bya ste
translated: Having meditated on this as long as one desires, one should see the one to be subjugated in front, arisen from the complete transformation of the letters of one's name, and one should meditate on him being summoned by the light rays arisen from the mantra rosary.

original: / de'i sems kyi rnam pa yongs su gyur pa las kun nas dmar pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: / de'i sems kyi rnam pa yongs su gyur pa las kun nas dmar pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that his mind is completely transformed into the form of a completely red moon disc.

original: sngags kyi phreng ba las lha mo sku mdog dmar mo phyag g-yon pas hr'i:yig gi zhags pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: sngags kyi phreng ba las lha mo sku mdog dmar mo phyag g-yon pas hr'i:yig gi zhags pa bsnams pa /
translated: One should see a goddess, red in color, arisen from the mantra rosary, holding a noose marked with the syllable HRĪḤ in her left hand,

original: phyag g-yas pas autpa la dmar po kha bye ba rdo rje'i lcags kyu lta bu bsnams pa bsgrub bya'i mdun du 'gro bar bltas te /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas autpa la dmar po kha bye ba rdo rje'i lcags kyu lta bu bsnams pa bsgrub bya'i mdun du 'gro bar bltas te /
translated: and holding an open red lotus like a vajra hook in her right hand, going in front of the one to be subjugated.

original: aom a'a:hr'i:/ aa mu ka sya tsitta m'a karsha ya h'um dza:zhes pas de la rnal 'byor pas bka' bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a:hr'i:/ aa mu ka sya tsitta m'a karsha ya h'um dza:zhes pas de la rnal 'byor pas bka' bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: The yogi should give her a command with OṂ AḤ HRĪḤ, the mind of such and such, draw him in, HŪṂ JAH!

original: de nas lha mo de cho ga bzhin du rab tu gzhug par bya bas zhags pas yang dag par bcings shing lcags kyus bskul zhing ji lta ba bzhin du bkug nas rang gi sems la rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lha mo de cho ga bzhin du rab tu gzhug par bya bas zhags pas yang dag par bcings shing lcags kyus bskul zhing ji lta ba bzhin du bkug nas rang gi sems la rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, the yogin should cause the goddess to enter in accordance with the rite, binding her with the noose, goading her with the goad, and summoning her in the proper way, he should cause her to enter his mind.

original: lha mo ni sngags kyi nang du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha mo ni sngags kyi nang du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The goddess should be seen within the mantra.

original: de nas de skra grol zhing rnam par myos shing 'dod pas myos par 'dod pas gcig pu dbang du gyur te lag pa thal mo sbyar nas sgrub pa po la gdong mngon par phyogs te mngag gzhug byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de skra grol zhing rnam par myos shing 'dod pas myos par 'dod pas gcig pu dbang du gyur te lag pa thal mo sbyar nas sgrub pa po la gdong mngon par phyogs te mngag gzhug byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, with loose hair, intoxicated, and mad with passion, she becomes his alone, with folded hands, facing the adept, she will do his bidding.

original: rdo rje phag mo'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of Vajravārāhī is complete.

original: // / phyogs kyi gos can skra grol ba'i rdo rje phag mo lte ba'i phyogs su gri gug dang thong pa bsnams shing gar mdzad pa bsgoms na dbang du byed par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: // / phyogs kyi gos can skra grol ba'i rdo rje phag mo lte ba'i phyogs su gri gug dang thong pa bsnams shing gar mdzad pa bsgoms na dbang du byed par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: If one meditates on Vajravārāhī with loose hair, wearing a skirt of the directions, holding a flaying knife and skull cup at her navel, and dancing, she will bring under one’s control.

original: rdo rje phag mo'i @234b dbang du bya ba'i cho ga'o//
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo'i @234b dbang du bya ba'i cho ga'o//
translated: The rite of bringing Vajravārāhī under one’s control.
